NV_CUDA_HOST_GROUP.name: CUDA
NV_CUDA_HOST_GROUP.description: The CUDA Toolkit provides a comprehensive development environment for C and C++ developers building GPU-accelerated applications.

NV_COMPUTERVISION_HOST_GROUP.name: Computer Vision
NV_COMPUTERVISION_HOST_GROUP.description: Libraries for Computer Vision and Image Processing.

NV_DEVTOOLS_HOST_GROUP.name: Developer Tools
NV_DEVTOOLS_HOST_GROUP.description: The NVIDIA Developer Tools are a collection of applications, which allow developers to build, debug, profile, and optimize class-leading and cutting-edge software.

NV_JETPACK_L4T_IMAGE_SETUP_TARGET_GROUP.name: Jetson OS image
NV_JETPACK_L4T_IMAGE_SETUP_TARGET_GROUP.description: Bootloader and root filesystem with kernel and NVIDIA drivers.

NV_ADDITIONAL_SETUP_TARGET_GROUP.name: Additional Setups
NV_ADDITIONAL_SETUP_TARGET_GROUP.description: Some necessary additional setups need to be done before target components install.

NV_CUDA_TARGET_GROUP.name: CUDA
NV_CUDA_TARGET_GROUP.description: The CUDA Toolkit provides a comprehensive development environment for C and C++ developers building GPU-accelerated applications.

NV_AI_TARGET_GROUP.name: AI
NV_AI_TARGET_GROUP.description: With TensorRT, you can deliver fast inference using INT8 or FP16 optimized precision that significantly reduces latency. The NVIDIA CUDA Deep Neural Network (cuDNN) library provides high-performance GPU acceleration for your application.

NV_COMPUTERVISION_TARGET_GROUP.name: Computer Vision
NV_COMPUTERVISION_TARGET_GROUP.description: Libraries for Computer Vision and Image Processing.

NV_DOCKER_TARGET_GROUP.name: NVIDIA Container Runtime
NV_DOCKER_TARGET_GROUP.description: NVIDIA Container Runtime with Docker integration. Build and run GPU accelerated containers with Docker

NV_MULTIMEDIA_API_TARGET_GROUP.name: Multimedia
NV_MULTIMEDIA_API_TARGET_GROUP.description: The Jetson Multimedia API package is a collection of lower-level APIs that support flexible application development.  The GStreamer framework is also included, providing high-level APIs.

NV_CUDA_HOST_COMP.name: CUDA on Host
NV_CUDA_HOST_COMP.description: CUDA to be installed on host. CUDA is a parallel computing platform and programming model invented by NVIDIA. It enables dramatic increases in computing performance by harnessing the power of the graphics processing unit (GPU).

postUninstallCommands.userCommand: sudo apt-key del $(apt-key list | grep cudatools -B 1| grep 'pub' | cut -d ' ' -f 4 | cut -d/ -f 2)
sudo apt-key del $(apt-key list | grep cudatools -B 1| grep 'pub' | cut -d ' ' -f 4 | cut -d/ -f 2)

NV_CUDA_HOST_CROSS_COMP.name: CUDA Cross Compile Package on Host
NV_CUDA_HOST_CROSS_COMP.description: CUDA Toolkit on Host for Cross Compiling. NVIDIA CUDA Toolkit provides a comprehensive development environment for C and C++ developers building GPU-accelerated applications.

NV_VISIONWORKS_HOST_COMP.name: VisionWorks on Host
NV_VISIONWORKS_HOST_COMP.description: NVIDIA VisionWorks Toolkit is a CUDA accelerated software development package for computer vision (CV) and image processing. The toolkit is designed to provide a production-quality, standard interface that implements and extends the OpenVX standard, enabling high performance computer vision applications on NVIDIA Tegra devices.

postUninstallCommands.userCommand: sudo apt-key del $(apt-key list | grep visionworks -B 1| grep 'pub' | cut -d ' ' -f 4 | cut -d/ -f 2)
sudo apt-key del $(apt-key list | grep visionworks -B 1| grep 'pub' | cut -d ' ' -f 4 | cut -d/ -f 2)
sudo apt-key del $(apt-key list | grep visionworks -B 1| grep 'pub' | cut -d ' ' -f 4 | cut -d/ -f 2)

NV_L4T_NVIDIA_NSIGHT_GRAPHICS_HOST_COMP.name: NVIDIA Nsight Graphics
NV_L4T_NVIDIA_NSIGHT_GRAPHICS_HOST_COMP.description: NVIDIA Nsight Graphics is a console-grade tool that allows developers to debug and profile OpenGL/GL ES applications.

NV_L4T_NVIDIA_NSIGHT_SYSTEMS_HOST_COMP.name: NVIDIA Nsight Systems
NV_L4T_NVIDIA_NSIGHT_SYSTEMS_HOST_COMP.description: NVIDIA Nsight Systems is a multi-core CPU sampling profiler that provides an interactive view of captured profiling data, helping improve overall application performance.

NV_L4T_DEVTOOLS_DOCS_HOST_COMP.name: DevTools Documentation
NV_L4T_DEVTOOLS_DOCS_HOST_COMP.description: Documentation for NVIDIA Nsight Systems and Tegra Graphics

NV_DEVICE_MODE_SETUP_IMAGE_COMP.name: Device Mode Host Setup in Flash
NV_DEVICE_MODE_SETUP_IMAGE_COMP.description: Setups for device mode host part in L4T  before flashing, to let the target can access host internet.

execBash: eth_port_name=$(ip route show default | awk '/default via/ {print $5; exit}')
echo 'Can not found route default $eth_port_name, device mode setup failed!'
echo 'Found route default' $eth_port_name', setting up device mode'
sudo iptables -A FORWARD -d $setup_t -m state --state ESTABLISHED,RELATED -i $eth_port_name -j ACCEPT
echo 'Device mode on host successfuly set with DNS 8.8.8.8!'
echo 'Default google DNS is not working, trying to find a valid server in local host settings!'
sudo iptables -t nat -A PREROUTING -p tcp -d 8.8.8.8 --dport 53 -j DNAT --to-destination $dns
sudo iptables -t nat -A PREROUTING -p udp -d 8.8.8.8 --dport 53 -j DNAT --to-destination $dns
echo 'Device mode on host successfuly set with DNS' $dns'!'
echo 'Can not found a valid DNS server, device mode setup failed!'
echo 'If needed to use device mode, please change the target default dns to a valid server by following the steps in release note.'

NV_DEVICE_MODE_SETUP_TARGET_COMP.name: Device Mode Host Setup in Target SDK
NV_DEVICE_MODE_SETUP_TARGET_COMP.description: Setups for device mode host part in L4T  before install target components, to let the target can access host internet.

execBash: eth_port_name=$(ip route show default | awk '/default via/ {print $5; exit}')
echo 'Can not found route default $eth_port_name, device mode setup failed!'
echo 'Found route default' $eth_port_name', setting up device mode'
sudo iptables -A FORWARD -d $setup_t -m state --state ESTABLISHED,RELATED -i $eth_port_name -j ACCEPT
echo 'Device mode on host successfuly set with DNS 8.8.8.8!'
echo 'Default google DNS is not working, trying to find a valid server in local host settings!'
sudo iptables -t nat -A PREROUTING -p tcp -d 8.8.8.8 --dport 53 -j DNAT --to-destination $dns
sudo iptables -t nat -A PREROUTING -p udp -d 8.8.8.8 --dport 53 -j DNAT --to-destination $dns
echo 'Device mode on host successfuly set with DNS' $dns'!'
echo 'Can not found a valid DNS server, device mode setup failed!'
echo 'If needed to use device mode, please change the target default dns to a valid server by following the steps in release note.'

NV_DATETIME_SETUP_TARGET_COMP.name: DateTime Target Setup
NV_DATETIME_SETUP_TARGET_COMP.description: Setup target DateTime to match host DateTime, to avoid the target DateTime mess for new devices or after devices RTC battery dried.

NV_L4T_CUDA_TARGET_POST_INSTALL_COMP.name: CUDA Toolkit for L4T
NV_L4T_CUDA_TARGET_POST_INSTALL_COMP.description: CUDA to be installed on target. CUDA is a parallel computing platform and programming model invented by NVIDIA. It enables dramatic increases in computing performance by harnessing the power of the graphics processing unit (GPU).

remoteExecBash: safe_apt_install "sudo apt-get install -y gnupg libgomp1 libfreeimage-dev libopenmpi-dev openmpi-bin" 5

NV_L4T_CUDNN_TARGET_POST_INSTALL_COMP.name: cuDNN on Target
NV_L4T_CUDNN_TARGET_POST_INSTALL_COMP.description: The NVIDIA CUDA Deep Neural Network library (cuDNN) is a GPU-accelerated library of primitives for deep neural networks. Deep learning developers and researchers worldwide rely on the highly optimized routines in cuDNN which allow them to focus on designing and training neural network models rather than spending time on low-level performance tuning.

NV_L4T_TENSORRT_DLA_TARGET_POST_INSTALL_.name: TensorRT on Target
NV_L4T_TENSORRT_DLA_TARGET_POST_INSTALL_.description:
NVIDIA TensorRT is a high-performance deep learning inference for production deployment of deep learning applications. It optimizes your trained neural networks for runtime performance and delivers GPU-accelerated services for data center, embedded and automotive applications.

The NVIDIA CUDA Deep Neural Network library (cuDNN) is a GPU-accelerated library of primitives for deep neural networks. Deep learning developers and researchers worldwide rely on the highly optimized routines in cuDNN which allow them to focus on designing and training neural network models rather than spending time on low-level performance tuning.

NV_L4T_TENSORRT_NODLA_TARGET_POST_INSTAL.name: TensorRT on Target
NV_L4T_TENSORRT_NODLA_TARGET_POST_INSTAL.description:
NVIDIA TensorRT is a high-performance deep learning inference for production deployment of deep learning applications. It optimizes your trained neural networks for runtime performance and delivers GPU-accelerated services for data center, embedded and automotive applications.

The NVIDIA CUDA Deep Neural Network library (cuDNN) is a GPU-accelerated library of primitives for deep neural networks. Deep learning developers and researchers worldwide rely on the highly optimized routines in cuDNN which allow them to focus on designing and training neural network models rather than spending time on low-level performance tuning.

remoteExecBash: safe_apt_install "sudo apt-get install -y python-dev python-numpy python-py python-pytest" 5

NV_L4T_VISIONWORKS_TARGET_POST_INSTALL_C.name: VisionWorks on Target
NV_L4T_VISIONWORKS_TARGET_POST_INSTALL_C.description: NVIDIA VisionWorks Toolkit is a CUDA accelerated software development package for computer vision (CV) and image processing. The toolkit is designed to provide a production-quality, standard interface that implements and extends the OpenVX standard, enabling high performance computer vision applications on NVIDIA Tegra devices.

NV_VPI_TARGET_POST_INSTALL_COMP.name: VPI
NV_VPI_TARGET_POST_INSTALL_COMP.description: Vision Programming Interface(VPI) is an API for accelerated computer vision and image processing for embedded systems.

NV_DOCKER_TARGET_POST_INSTALL_COMP.name: NVIDIA Container Runtime with Docker integration (Beta)
NV_DOCKER_TARGET_POST_INSTALL_COMP.description: NVIDIA Container Runtime with Docker integration. Build and run GPU accelerated containers with Docker.

NV_MULTIMEDIA_API_TARGET_POST_INSTALL_T1.name: Multimedia API
NV_MULTIMEDIA_API_TARGET_POST_INSTALL_T1.description:
Multimedia API offers developers to use the lower level APIs for flexible application development. This is in addition to the Gstreamer framework available from the previous releases.
The APIs include Argus API for imaging applications and V4L2 for encode, decode, scaling and other media functions. These lower level APIs provide a better control over the underlying hardware blocks.
